intro: Heliophila thunbergii var. macrostylis, commonly known as the broad-styled heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
